DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Localization Performed Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field related to a surgical procedure that is used to mark the location of a breast abnormality that is quite small, or that can't be easily found by touch.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a surgical procedure that is used to mark the location of a breast abnormality that is quite small, or that can't be easily found by touch.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: (LO-kal-ih-ZAY-shun) The process of determining or marking the location or site of a lesion or disease. May also refer to the process of keeping a lesion or disease in a specific location or site.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The process of determining or marking the location or site of a lesion or disease.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
